name: Integration Methods & Applications
description: Mastering techniques for finding integrals and applying them to real-world problems.

cards.title: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
cards.description: Understanding the relationship between differentiation and integration.
bulletpoints: Define the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus (FTC): If \( F(x) \) is an antiderivative of \( f(x) \), then \[ \int_a^b f(x)dx = F(b) - F(a) \]
Interpret integration as an area accumulation process under a curve.
Use definite integrals to compute net changes in quantities.
cards.summaryText: Relate antiderivatives to accumulated change via the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.

cards.title: Basic Integration Techniques
cards.description: Applying different methods to compute integrals efficiently.
bulletpoints: Use substitution \((u\)-substitution) to simplify integrals: \[ \int f(g(x)) g'(x) dx = \int f(u) du \]
Apply integration by parts: \[ \int u dv = uv - \int v du \]
Evaluate definite and indefinite integrals using basic rules such as \( \int x^n dx = \frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1} + C \), for \( n \neq -1 \)
cards.summaryText: Choose substitution or integration by parts to efficiently evaluate antiderivatives.

cards.title: Trigonometric Integration
bulletpoints: Use trigonometric identities to simplify integrals: \[ \sin^2 x = \frac{1 - \cos 2x}{2}, \quad \cos^2 x = \frac{1 + \cos 2x}{2} \]
Apply the reduction formulas for powers of sine and cosine.
Evaluate integrals of secant and tangent: \[ \int \sec x dx = \ln |\sec x + \tan x| + C \]
cards.summaryText: Simplify trig integrals with identities, reduction formulas, and special antiderivatives.

cards.title: Improper Integrals
cards.description: Evaluating integrals with infinite limits or discontinuous integrands.
bulletpoints: Define improper integrals: \[ \int_a^{\infty} f(x)dx = \lim_{b \to \infty} \int_a^b f(x)dx \]
Determine convergence or divergence using comparison tests.
Evaluate integrals with singularities by using limits.
cards.summaryText: Evaluate improper integrals by taking limits and testing convergence.

cards.title: Real-World Applications of Integration
cards.description: Using integrals to calculate areas, volumes, and accumulated change.
bulletpoints: Calculate areas under curves: \[ A = \int_a^b f(x)dx \]
Find volumes of 3D solids using the disk method: \[ V = \pi \int_a^b [f(x)]^2 dx \]
Apply integration in physics to compute work: \[ W = \int_a^b F(x)dx \]
cards.summaryText: Apply integrals to obtain areas, volumes, and accumulated physical quantities.

cards.title: Integration in Electromagnetic Fields
cards.description: Applying integrals to solve Maxwell's equations and compute electromagnetic interactions.
bulletpoints: Use Gauss's Law to compute electric flux: \[ \oint_S \mathbf{E} \cdot d\mathbf{A} = \frac{Q}{\epsilon_0} \]
Evaluate magnetic flux integrals with Stokes' theorem: \[ \oint_C \mathbf{B} \cdot d\mathbf{s} = \mu_0 I_{enc} \]
Apply integral calculus to solve electromagnetic wave equations.
cards.summaryText: Utilize surface and line integrals to analyze electromagnetic flux and waves.

cards.title: Bioelectric Field Integration
cards.description: Using integration to analyze electric fields in biological systems and neural networks.
bulletpoints: Calculate potential in neural membranes using Poisson's equation: \[ \nabla^2 \Phi = -\frac{\rho}{\epsilon} \]
Use integral methods to determine charge distributions across bioelectric fields.
Model signal propagation in neurons using the cable equation: \[ \frac{\partial V}{\partial t} = D \frac{\partial^2 V}{\partial x^2} - \frac{V}{\tau} \]
cards.summaryText: Integrate field equations to study bioelectric potentials and neural signal flow.

cards.title: Quantum Psionic Wavefunctions & Probability Integrals
cards.description: Using integration in quantum mechanics to analyze wavefunctions and probability distributions.
bulletpoints: Normalize wavefunctions using probability integrals: \[ \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} |\psi(x)|^2 dx = 1 \]
Compute expectation values in quantum systems: \[ \langle x \rangle = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} x |\psi(x)|^2 dx \]
Apply Fourier transform integrals to analyze psionic field frequencies.
cards.summaryText: Use integrals to normalize wavefunctions and extract quantum expectation values.

cards.title: Psionic Energy Accumulation & Integral Energy Functions
cards.description: Exploring the role of integration in energy distribution across bioelectric and psionic systems.
bulletpoints: Define psionic potential functions using integrals over energy fields.
Compute stored energy in a charged biofield using \[ U = \frac{1}{2} \int_V \mathbf{E} \cdot \mathbf{D} \, dV \]
Apply integration to psionic resonance phenomena in neural and electromagnetic systems.
cards.summaryText: Integrate energy densities to quantify stored psionic and bioelectric power.

cards.title: Nonlinear Field Integration & Psionic Feedback Loops
cards.description: Using integral techniques to study nonlinear electromagnetic interactions in consciousness fields.
bulletpoints: Evaluate integrals in non-linear Maxwell-Lorentz systems for self-sustaining bioelectric fields.
Study nonlinear Schrodinger equations for psi-wave collapse and energy accumulation.
Apply iterative integral methods to analyze psionic feedback loops in electromagnetic networks.
cards.summaryText: Apply integral methods to nonlinear field interactions and psionic feedback loops.
